meanings.definition: To take a photograph of something that has already been photographed.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys rephotographing old family pictures to see how things have changed over time.
meanings.sent2: The photographer spent the day rephotographing famous landmarks for a new project.
meanings.sent3: After rephotographing the same flower for the tenth time, she realized it was actually a plastic decoration.
meanings.sent4: His mind was like a camera, constantly rephotographing memories to preserve them forever.
meanings.sent5: The concept of rephotographing is like taking a snapshot of history within a snapshot.

meanings.definition: The act of capturing an image that has been previously captured.
meanings.sent1: The rephotographing of the painting revealed hidden details not visible in the original.
meanings.sent2: He studied the rephotographing closely, comparing it to the original print.
meanings.sent3: The museum curator joked that rephotographing was like playing a game of visual telephone.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for rephotographing was akin to a treasure hunter seeking lost artifacts.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of rephotographing lies in uncovering new perspectives within familiar scenes.
